title: Hello, Python World!
story: Welcome to your first Python quest! Every programmer starts their journey by greeting the world. In this quest, you'll learn how to use Python's print() function to display messages.
instructions: Use the `print()` function to output the text "Hello, World!" exactly as shown (including the comma and exclamation mark).

hints.text: Use the print() function to display text
Text in Python needs to be wrapped in quotes: "text"
The exact solution is: print("Hello, World!")
